result.execSummary:
The defendant Jay A. Iverson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

If agent recommends, attend and successfully complete Domestic Violence Court.

DV Court - no show by defendant.  Court called T.M. to let her know and asked her to do the warrant.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.    The defendant appears by video from the Jackson County Jail.  No counsel present.  Court recieved an email from Agent T.M.  Getting conflicting information from health care and job.  Court vacated the sanction order.
for Domestic Violence Court Jail Sanction
DV court.  Medical issue discussed.  Work comp discussed.  Discussion on how his job was terminated from Ashley.  Court described problems with his stories.  30 day sanction ordered.
T.M. hasn't heard back from employer yet.  He is to sign releases for providers.
for Domestic Violence Court Jail Sanction
DV court.  He's not doing good.  He's trying to get a release from Ashley for the group.  Missed appointment with B.G.  Didn't tell Agent T.M.  6 day jail sanction starting now.
DV Court.  Work discussed.  He's looking to transfer to a different job.  Sign a release at work so that the agent can talk to them.
DV court.  Discussion on how job is going.  Did AODA assessment.
DV court.  Working at Ashley now.  He will talk to T.M after court today.  AODA assessment done.  Waiting for insurance to start with Ashley.
for Domestic Violence Court Jail Sanction

DV court.  Priority in DV court.  Can't miss DV court.  CS hours not turned in.  3 weeks not turned in.  9 days jail, starting immediately.  He says he was doing CS.  Defendant argued with the court.  He hasn't done 24 hours per week.  Will be tested when he goes to the jail.
DV court.  Working community service.  Let agent know of employment right away.  Not to go to the Whitetail Crossing, or will be put in jail.  No contact with that individual at all.

Hearing recorded - DV Court

No appearance by defenant - TM will issue warrant.
for Domestic Violence Court Jail Sanction

DV court.  He missed B.G.'s class.  Made arrangments with B.G.  Confirm date and time with B.G.  Look into AODA.  Must be DOC approved.  3 day sanction.  Schedule.  Must start by 6:00 pm., a week from Friday.
DV court.  Started with B.G.  He has a job @ Northern Engraving.  They are working with the DV court schedule.  Has an appointment with agent.

ADDRESS INFO for Jay A. Iverson
Current: W12790 NW Joos Rd., Alma Center, WI 54611 United States  (Effective: 08-19-2016)

DV Court.  First time.  Court explained how it works.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Terrien.  Defendant plead guilty to Resisting in count 2.  Count 1 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Resisting, contrary to 946.41(1).  State recommended:  90-120 days jail.  Defense recommended:  1 year probation.  Court ordered:  8 months imposed & stayed.  1 year probation.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC DNA sample.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Subject to random testing by his agent.  DV court, if agent recommends.

Status conference on July 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
